Rules: The contest shall consist of solving a series of challenges to reach the goal.

The contest will mainly deal with computer-based puzzles and tasks. Your knowledge of Computers, the internet (latest happenings around the world) and related technical and Non-technical stuff will be put to the test.
Round 1 Rules: The first one to successfully reach the goal, completing all challenges will qualify for round 2.
Round 2 Rules: The first one to successfully reach the goal, completing all challenges will qualify for round 2.

Rules: 1. Title and names of the group members should be mentioned.
2. Two presenter per team max.
3. Presentation time of 7mins per team to present idea followed by questions from judges.
4. Contents should be clearly listed using appropriate fonts and colors
5. Use of proper headings/subtitles are desired.
6. Content should give idea of what the project is about
7. Decision made by the Coordinator/Company will be final incase any problems
8. Mode :Microsoft Team
1. Only registered teams will be allowed to share their game applications.
2. The team will be able to work on their project from 28th September onwards to 6th October.
3. Once registered all team members must join the WhatsApp group as all schedule announcements will be made on it.
4. The WhatsApp group will also be used to share resources on how to make games to help newer developers such to encourage more participation.
5. A minimum of 1 level of your game must be completed.
6. You can create either one of these types of games: Mobile, PC (Windows), Web
7. Augmented reality and virtual reality applications are also allowed
8. Your games will be judge according to the following criteria of Theme, Core gameplay, Asset diversity, Technical implementation, Presentation.

9. You will be allowed to use any individual assets, but you cannot use any full scene or full game prefabs. (E.g., A premade house model is acceptable, but a full scene with the player and environment already made is not.). For further details you can contact the coordinators.
10. Once completed you must share the link to your game application to us using any online storage service (e.g., google drive) before 7th October 2021 10:00 a.m.
11. Then on the very same day we will evaluate and pick the few best projects and they will have to explain a little about their game on the 8th of October 2021 will the judges try out their games.
12. The winners will be announced on 9th October.
13. For further questions contact the coordinators.

Guidelines: Participants will have to sign up online via the Website. Registration can be done before 10 am on Day1.

The participants need to ensure that the necessary pre-requisites/working environment is set up on their laptops in advance so that time allotted during the hackathon is not spent on software installations.
Rules: Individual applications.
Developed Solutions should be original and not copied.
Do not use proprietary software. Use open-source software.

build-startup.event-name: Building a Startup of the Future, Now!

Rules: 1. Registration for the workshop should compulsorily be a group participation. The minimum number of members should be 3 and maximum 5 in a group.
Prizes: A 6-month long internship opportunity at Hexcoderz.
Guidance to actually build the startup and launch to market.
Access to their startup studio over the weekend to build products

Materials: Tape or stapler should be used only on the joints and junctions of the straws and not on its entire length.
Taping the entire Roadway is not allowed.
Compulsory event for all the First Years.
Note: Not necessary to use all the straws.
The team leader will be added to a Whatsapp group where all the other instructions and queries regarding the event will be answerd.
Dimensions: Total height= 15 cm max above the support.
Roadway: 3cm max thickness (vehicle/ box of 15cm x 8cm dimensions must be able to pass through the entire length of the bridge with no obstruction).
Loading conditions: The load will be applied vertically at the centre of the bridge.
Support: Support will be provided for the bridge to sit on.
Supports will be placed 30 cm apart.
Weight: If there is a tie, bridge having minimum weight will be considered as winner.
Round 1 (qualification round): Bridges failing to meet the given dimensions or failing to abide by the above rules will be disqualified.
Round 2 (Load and Look Test): Judges will give marks out of 100 for the overall aesthetics of the bridge.
These marks will be then added to the maximum load the bridge takes before collapsing.
The bridge with higher total points will be declared as the winner.
Eg:- Marks for looks – 70, Total load taken - 1100gm, Total points – 1100+70=1170
Judges decision will be final and no issues will be entertained after the declaration of the results.

Rules: The team leaders will be added to a whatsapp group after registration.
The event will be held in offline mode in Padre Conceicao college of engineering, Verna.
Teams can start their setup from day 1 of Techyon in the area provided to them.
Incase the participating team cannot make it to the college they can present via Google meet and recorded video, the rules of the same will be sent on the whatsapp group.
Final decision will be made by the judges and no objections will be entertained after the results are declared.
A space of 3mX3mX3m (l*b*h) can be used by each team.
Each hand touches will cause deduction of 10 points.
Only one chance is allowed to complete the process.
Use of explosives is not allowed
Any other queries will be answered in the whatsapp group itself.
Allocation of points: Total no. of energy conversion - 30 points
Number of distinct energy conversions -30 points
Extra ordinary conversion - 40 points(depending on judges)

Problem statement: To build a unique mechanism which has a useful purpose that gives an output. The output may be the application of force, linear or rotary motion.
Rules:: A team should consist of 2-5 members
The event will be held in offline mode.
Incase the participating team cannot make it to the college they can present via Google meet and recorded video, the rules of the same will be sent on the whatsapp group.
A working model should be assembled and ready for display prior to competition date
Participants will be given time to present their mechanism to the judges.
Buying the entire mechanism form any supplier will lead to disqualification.
There are no restrictions on type of material used.
Judges decision will be final and no objections will be entertained after the results are declared.
Any other queries regarding the event can be asked in the whatsapp group.
This is an individual event and no teams of 2 or more will be entertained.
The event will be held online via Google Classroom.
Time limit for the completion of the solid model and submission of the same will be 2 hours only.
Each participant will have to complete 2 designs in the given period upto the specifications required.
Exceeding the time limit will result in reduction of points. The solid model to be designed will be sent on the spot.
The model will be checked for dimensional accuracy and finishing (chamfer, fillet, etc.)
It is requested to remain honest and avoid taking help or cheating during the event.
Any doubts about the rules can contact the coordinators in the Whatsapp group of the participants that will be created.
The judging criteria and decision shall be final and no argument will be entertained for the same.

Description: Workshop will be on basic concepts of robotics & Arduino.
Insight on different robotics competition in Goa.
Instructions: Use the registration link to register for the workshop.
Those registered will be added in a whatsapp group.
The details of the workshop will then be shared in the whatsapp group itself.
The workshop is meant for the 1st and 2nd year students only.

Rules: Maximum 2 participants per team allowed.
Total number of rounds – 3
Both participants of a team should be from same college.
If dishonest methods used, teams will be disqualified immediately.
Tie-breaker set of questions will be provided in case of tie between teams.
Round 1: General round: Written examination in case of more teams registered.
Each team will be provided with set of 15 objective questions, teams have to solve the questions within 15 minutes.
Further 3/5 questions would be asked in case of tie between teams for final selection.
Top scoring teams will be shortlisted for Rapid fire round.
Round 2: Rapid fire: Shortlisted teams will be asked set of questions one after another.
Very short time limit assigned for each question per team.
If a team cannot answer the question, they can say pass for the next question. The question will not be forwarded to the next team.
Round 3: Buzzer round: A question will be posed to all teams and the team which presses the buzzer first will be given the chance to answer.
10 marks will be awarded for correct answer and 5 marks will be deducted for wrong answer. No answer no deduction of marks.
This round will be video recorded in case teams press the buzzer at same time, to avoid conflicts.
Winner will be declared who has highest marks.

The overall specifications of the bot mu: no lego and ready made bot.
Rules: A team can comprise of a maximum of 3 members.
The competition will be of 2 rounds. Round 1 shall be a qualifier round and round 2 shall be the final round.
In round 1, each team will give 2 time trials. Least time and with best out of 2 given trails will be judged upon.
For the 1st trial a test run of 3 Mins will be given after which, immediately 1st time trial will follow
Team can give 2nd and Final trail immediately after 1st or later in the competition . There won't be any TEST RUN for 2nd trial.
The bot must cover the entire track within 4 min minutes to qualify for the final round
Any shortcut paths and deviation from the main line will lead to placing of the bot back to the nearest check point. Coordinators decision will be counted as the final.
In case if no bot is able to complete the track in given time, bot covering maximum checkpoint in minimum time will be shortlisted for the final round.
Width of the line will be 3cm.The participants shall be informed in prior by the event coordinators if there is any change in the width of the line.
The Line Follower Bot must be fully self-contained and must not be externally operated by wire or remote radio control during the course of the race.
Before commencement of the actual racing, the teams will be allowed to test their bots on the track but only for limited period of time as decided by the coordinators
Once the bot is placed on the track, a maximum of 8 touches will be allowed to reset the bot on the right track and a penalty of 5 sec per touch shall be added to the total time.

Winner shall be the group which finishes the track in the shortest time. In case no team manages to finish the track, then the prize shall be given to the team who completes most part of the track in shortest time and with minimum touches.

Description: Workshop for EComp students on Arduino Basics

Event Theme : LIFE IN DEEP BLUE 🐙🦑🦐🦞🦀🐡🐠🐟: Under this theme participants are required to make a small miniature representation of underwater landscape having any 1 aquatic animal compulsory
The size of the artwork cannot exceed more then 50*50*50 cm
Use of all electronic components is allowed such as different leds ,led panels,sensors and all those components which will bring the spark in the artwork
Use of microcontrollers is also allowed
Participants should be present at the designated class/lab prior the event timing ,failing to will lead to disqualification

C/Python Programming: Compulsory Event for all TE ETC students
This contest will contain total of 3 rounds
Round 1 (30min): 60% needed to qualify from Round 1 to Round 2
Round 2 (20min): 60% needed to qualify from Round 2 to Round 3
Note:: Rules are same for both C and Python programming
Winner will be decided based on the highest marks scored in all the 3 rounds together

Rules: The poster should depicts your project. It should showcase your creativity and innovation.
Each team consists of the project group
Each team can display only one poster.
The poster should be on a flex sheet.
The dimensions of the poster must be 5ft*4ft(fixed size).
The poster should have title,objective, block diagram/flowchart,advantages & disadvantages,future scope and it's applications
Participants must be present at the designated class/lab prior to the event time, failing which will lead to disqualification
Participants must register online prior to the event
Entry is Free
